de.boereck.matcher.function.optionalmap

Interface OptionalIntMapper<I>

  • Type Parameters:
    I - Type of input to the function
    All Superinterfaces:
    Function<I,OptionalInt>
    Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface OptionalIntMapper<I>
extends Function<I,OptionalInt>
    Function mapping an input of type I to an OptionalInt. The result of this function should never be null, even though most combinator methods of this interface are prepared for this. This interface is especially useful when working with NoResultCaseMatcher.caseInt(Function, IntConsumer), or ResultCaseMatcher.caseInt(Function, IntFunction).

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> filter(IntPredicate after)
      Returns an optional mapper filtering the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper with the given predicate after.
      default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(IntFunction<Optional<V>> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default OptionalDoubleMapper<I> flatMapD(IntFunction<OptionalDouble> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> flatMapI(IntFunction<OptionalInt> after)
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.

      Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional.
      default Predicate<I> hasResult()
      Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and checks if the returned OptionalInt contains a value.
      default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(IntPredicate test)
      Returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.

      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalInt contains a value.

      default OptionalLongMapper<I> mapL(IntToLongFunction after)
      Returns a function that will first call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalInt contains a value.
      default OptionalIntMapper<I> nullAware()
      This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional.
      default TestableToIntFunction<I> orElse(int o)
      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o.
      default TestableToIntFunction<I> orElseGet(IntSupplier supplier)
      Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalInt with the given value supplier.
      default TestableToIntFunction<I> partial()
      Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it.

    • Method Detail

      • map

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> map(IntFunction<? extends V> after)
                             throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will first call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards calls checks if the OptionalInt contains a value. If so, the value in the optional will be used as an input to the given mapping function after and returned in an optional, otherwise an empty optional will be returned. If the result of this OptionalIntMapper is null, an empty OptionalInt will be returned.
        Type Parameters:
        V - Type of element held by output optional
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the value of the returned OptionalInt of this OptionalIntMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function mapping the result value of this OptionalIntMapper (provided the OptionalInt holds a value).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

If the result of this OptionalIntMapper is null, an empty OptionalInt will be returned.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called on the value of the returned OptionalInt of this OptionalIntMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function mapping the result value of this OptionalIntMapper (provided the OptionalInt holds a value).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if parameter after is null.

      • flatMap

        default <V> OptionalMapper<I,V> flatMap(IntFunction<Optional<V>> after)
                                 throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional. If the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null or empty, the resulting function will return an empty optional.
        Type Parameters:
        V - result type of optional returned by after mapper function.
        Parameters:
        after - mapping function that will be called with the value of the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional. If the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is empty or null, the resulting function will return an empty optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will the thrown if after is null.

If the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null or empty, the resulting function will return an empty optional.

        Returns:
        function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and afterwards, if the returned OptionalInt contains a value, calls the after mapping function with that value and returns the resulting optional. If the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is empty or null, the resulting function will return an empty optional.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will the thrown if after is null.

      • filter

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> filter(IntPredicate after)
                             throws NullPointerException
        Returns an optional mapper filtering the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper with the given predicate after. This means that function returns an empty OptionalInt if either this OptionalIntMapper returns null, or an empty OptionalInt, or if the OptionalInt returned from this OptionalIntMapper holds a value, but the predicate after returns false for the value held in the OptionalInt. If the predicate returns true, the function will return the OptionalInt returned from this OptionalIntMapper.
        Parameters:
        after - function being used to filter on the OptionalInt returned from this OptionalIntMapper. This parameter must not be null.
        Returns:
        optional mapper filtering the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper with the given predicate after.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if after is null.

      • hasResult

        default Predicate<I> hasResult()
        Returns a function that will call this OptionalIntMapper and checks if the returned OptionalInt contains a value. If this OptionalIntMapper returns null, the predicate will return false.
        Returns:
        function checking if the result of this OptionalIntMapper is not null and holds a value

      • hasResultAnd

        default Predicate<I> hasResultAnd(IntPredicate test)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a predicate checking if the optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Parameters:
        test - predicate checking if the result value returned by this OptionalIntMapper
        Returns:
        predicate checking if optional value returned by this OptionalIntMapper is tested positive. is not null, holds a value, and if the predicate test returns true for this value.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - will be thrown if test is null.

      • thenDo

        default Consumer<I> thenDo(Consumer<OptionalInt> consumer)
                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and feeds the result to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result of this OptionalIntMapper, when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and feeds the result to the parameter consumer.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • thenIfPresent

        default Consumer<I> thenIfPresent(IntConsumer consumer)
                           throws NullPointerException
        Returns a consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, if the returned Optional holds a value, feeds this value to the given consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - consumes the result value of the Optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper (if value is present), when the returned Consumer is invoked.
        Returns:
        consumer that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and feeds the content of the resulting Optional to the parameter consumer (if value exists).
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElse

        default TestableToIntFunction<I> orElse(int o)
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned Optional with the given value o. If the Optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Parameters:
        o - value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalIntMapper returns null, or an empty Optional.
        Returns:
        function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElse on the returned OptionalInt with the given value o. If the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null, the function will return value o.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • orElseGet

        default TestableToIntFunction<I> orElseGet(IntSupplier supplier)
                                    throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function that takes an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalInt with the given value supplier. If the Optional returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Parameters:
        supplier - supplies value that will be returned from the function returned by this method if either this OptionalIntMapper returns null, or an empty OptionalInt.
        Returns:
        function taking an input value, calls this OptionalIntMapper with it, and calls orElseGet on the returned OptionalInt with the given value supplier. If the OptionalInt returned by this OptionalIntMapper is null, the function will return the value provided by supplier.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if consumer is null.

      • nullAware

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> nullAware()
        This method will return a function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalIntMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty OptionalInt will be returned. So effectively null checks will be performed on input and output of the function. Exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalIntMapper will also be thrown at the caller of the returned function.
        Returns:
        function that checks if the input is null and if so returns an empty optional. Otherwise it will call this OptionalIntMapper and if the result is not null, returns it. If the result is null, an empty OptionalInt will be returned.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> withCatch()
        The returned function will execute this OptionalIntMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalInt in this case. It is recommended to handle the exception, e.g. by using method <E extends Throwable> withCatch(Class<E>, Consumer<E>) or withCatch(Consumer<Exception>) instead.
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalIntMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an Exception, this will be caught and swallowed(!); the function will return an empty OptionalInt in this case.

      • withCatch

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalIntMapper<I> withCatch(Class<E> clazz,
                                                             Consumer<E> handler)
                                                      throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this OptionalIntMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an throwable of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the Exception; the function will return an empty OptionalInt in this case. Throwables of other types will be re-thrown. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - type of throwable to be caught
        Parameters:
        clazz - type of throwable to be caught
        handler - consumer handling the throwable
        Returns:
        function that will execute this OptionalIntMapper and potentially handling exceptions of type clazz with handler. After handling exceptions, the function will return an empty OptionalInt.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or handler are null.

      • withCatch

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> withCatch(Consumer<Exception> handler)
                                throws NullPointerException
        The returned function will execute this OptionalIntMapper and if it executes without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalInt in this case. If the handler itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        handler - will handle exceptions being thrown during the execution of this OptionalIntMapper
        Returns:
        function execution this OptionalIntMapper and if execution performs without any problem, the result will be returned. If the execution throws an exception of type clazz, it will be caught and the consumer handler will be called with the exception; the function will return an empty OptionalInt in this case.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if handler is null.

      • recoverWith

        default OptionalIntMapper<I> recoverWith(Function<? super Throwable,OptionalInt> recovery)
                                  throws NullPointerException
        Returns a function executing this OptionalIntMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalInt should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Parameters:
        recovery - method providing a regular result value if the OptionalIntMapper throws an exception.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalIntMapper and if a throwable is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. If an empty OptionalInt should be returned, consider using method withCatch() instead.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if recovery is null.

      • recoverWith

        default <E extends Throwable> OptionalIntMapper<I> recoverWith(Class<E> clazz,
                                                               Function<? super E,OptionalInt> recovery)
        Returns a function executing this OptionalIntMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller. If the recovery method itself will throw an exception, it will not be caught and propagated to the caller of the function.
        Type Parameters:
        E - Type of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class of exceptions to be caught and recovered from.
        recovery - function recovering from an exception providing a regular value to return from the returned function.
        Returns:
        function executing this OptionalIntMapper and if a an exception of type E is thrown during the execution, the given recovery function is used to provide a value to be returned. Exceptions of other types will be re-thrown to the caller.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if clazz or recovery are null.

      • partial

        default TestableToIntFunction<I> partial()
        Converts this optional mapper to a function that will perform the mapper and check if there is a result available and return it. If the returned optional is null or empty, the function will throw a NoSuchElementException.
        Returns:
        function not defined on inputs produce empty optionals. This means that if there this mapper produces an optional holding a value, this will be returned. Otherwise a NoSuchElementException is thrown.
